bug.short_desc: make use of sonar installation on Eclipse.org

long_desc.thetext:
Sonar is now available on Eclipse.org:
* http://wiki.eclipse.org/Sonar * https://dev.eclipse.org/sonar/
We should consider running the sonar:sonar goal as part of integration test builds.

Setting up Sonar is actually very simple: https://hudson.eclipse.org/hudson/view/Mylyn/job/mylyn-commons-nightly/configure
* Select Sonar under Post-build actions * Set the Maven version to 3.0.5 * Set additional properties to -Dmaven.repo.local=$WORKSPACE/.repository
Tomasz, would you be willing to make the same change for the other nightly jobs? I think that makes more sense than doing that for the integration builds anyways.
In addition "coverage.skip=false" should be set as a property to enable jacoco.
I enabled sonar for some of the nightly builds but they are now failing due to sonar not responding: bug 418751.

Here is the full list of the job properties for the Hudson jobs:
* Set the following property under Maven 3 Properties ** coverage.skip=false * Select Sonar under Post-build actions ** Set the Maven version to 3.0.5 ** Set MAVEN_OPTS to -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m ** Set additional properties to -Dmaven.repo.local=$WORKSPACE/.repository
Sonar is now enabled for all nightly jobs. Results are published to: https://dev.eclipse.org/sonar/.
One note regarding the setup: It should be -Dmaven.repo.local=$WORKSPACE/.maven/repo under Advanced Sonar settings to ensure the Maven cache is shared with the build.
